name: Holiday Inn Porto Gaia

reviews.text: I stayed only one night but wished to be more nights! The room was big, very confortable, clean and with a very nice decor! When you enter in the hotel, the lobby is great, stylish decor. Great breakfast, the internet is wifi and free and worked perfectly. Didnt had the chance to try the Spa and pool but i totally recommend a stay there! the only problem was one taxi driver even with GPS had some difficult finding the entrance! :)
reviews.title: What a great surprise!

reviews.text: Hi i stayed inthis amazing Hotel and i absolutely loved It. Its very confortable very fashionable in style and has a very good breakfast, shops at 5 minutes walk by foot and the city center of Porto its 5 minutes by car.
reviews.title: very good hotel exquisite!

reviews.text: Let me first compliment the excellent rooms that are kept clean and absolutely comfortable. It was very tiring travelling and finding the hotel at first, but the stay is absolutely worthwhile. I stayed three nights in HI Porto and it was the most comfortable time I had in Portugal.
reviews.title: Home in Porto

reviews.text: For all three nights, I also had the pleasure of dining in the restaurant. I must again, pay compliments to the excellent cuisine served, but more importantly, the excellent staff that you have. In particular, the restaurant manager, Paulo, was absolutely attentive, friendly and treated me with nothing but kindness and understanding. He also prepared one of my dinner for one night. His skills in preparing the black pepper steak is exquisite, to the extent that I went back another night for the same steak again. This time, it was the master chef, Francisco who prepared my steak and he is, indeed the master chef. The steak was so beautifully prepared and went very well with the wine served.
reviews.title: Difficult to find but worth the search

reviews.text: I had such a wonderful time visiting the Douro Valley and Porto that I did not want to leave, or at least a few more days would be nice.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Porto

reviews.text: We stayed for five nights in September and were really pleased with our choice of hotel. It is perhaps a 20-30 minute walk from the river, is very easily accessible by public transport and is very conveniently located near El Cortes Ingles. The room was large and comfortable, the food was excellent and the general atmosphere was warm and friendly. During our stay my husband suffered a back injury and the staff, particularly Carla the Rooms Division Manager, could not have been more helpful with organising medical care, speaking with doctors and pharmacists on our behalf, collecting prescriptions, even finding a car seat for our baby so that we could return to the airport by taxi. Nothing was too much trouble and the care and attention of the staff meant that despite some difficulties we still enjoyed our visit to a fantastic city. I would highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely staff

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights on a "points-break" - the rooms were practically given away, but despite that we were still upgraded to river-view rooms which were excellent. This hotel is definitely worth 4-stars rather than the more usual 3-star designation for Holiday Inns. Although the hotel is outside of Porto itself, it is still close enough to be a good base for a city-break, with just a short walk to the metro and the hop-on-hop-off bus. Hotel resraurnt is OK, but there are no others in the immediate vicinity so eat in town if you want anything else.
reviews.title: Full 4-star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the hotel with points from the priority club. I usually stay in Intercontinental, but decided to try Holiday Inn since there was an offer.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: I have to say I am happily surprised. The hotel holds a very good standard and all the people in the hotel were very helpful and friendly. The room was spacious with a magnificant view over the river in town and there are easy communications with either bus or tram close to the hotel.
reviews.title: The staff makes this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitly choose this hotel again next time I go to Porto.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in every respect!

reviews.text: The location is very good and convenient, the view to Oporto and the Douro river from the top floors is quite amazing. The rooms are very good and all the decoration of the Hotel very interesting. The staff very friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Quite a good surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long trip we were welcomed, with a smile, a glass of port and a an upgrade, who could ask for more from a hotel. Will definitely stay here again, not completely central but an easy jump to the centre and avoids crazy parking costs in the centre of Porto.
reviews.title: Great service at a fair price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here on HI points. We had looked at the reviews on TA before booking and were impressed so we booked.
reviews.title: The Best Holiday Inn I've ever stayed at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting there - the hotel is on the opposite side of Porto from the airport and cost us 30 euro each way in the taxi. You can do it for about 26 euro without a tip. Going by taxi is probably the best method to get to the hotel. The metro will cost about 5 euros each way from the airport (go to Joan De Deus) but if you have luggage there is about a 10 minute walk mainly uphill from the metro station so you may struggle.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in - very good staff who saw to everything we needed. All spoke perfect English. After check in you walk down the hallway to the lifts this is an optical illusion - I'll let you find out for yourseves what I mean.
reviews.title: Great place with nice prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you drive to Oporto this a great option. I found it hard to imagine what one would do with a car if you stayed in the narrow street filled center of Oporto. We were here for 3 nights. We parked the car right in front of the hotel (no charge) and left it there. One can get across the river by taxi or walk to the metro, just 15-20 minutes away. The walk is not that bad (we are in our 60's). We had a room on the Executive Floor and loved the view of the city. Staff spoke great English and were very helpful. The internet worked great and breakfast was quite good. They have a huge breakfast room and can accommodate large numbers. My only small irritation was that the air conditioning took a long time to really get the room at a decent temperature and it still felt a bit stuffy. Otherwise this is a great property to consider.
reviews.title: Wonder Oporto Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very nice stay, used our points and treated well. Room was large suite with fantastic view. Close to buses, taxis waiting. It was a 15 minute walk downhill to catch the hop on hop off bus at the El Corte Ingles shopping center. The staff was the best world wide. This hotel is mostly used for business , so quiet at times, but really lovely.
reviews.title: Gaia

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in a family duplex room. Really good for families, two double rooms, 2 bathrooms and a lounge. Everything very clean and comfortable. Breakfast very good choice and quality. Hotel staff friendly and knowledgable.
reviews.title: Stay with young family

reviews.text: I was in this hotel in the last month (from 25th to 28th) with my family to spend my holidays. I arrived at this hotel without a reservation, was a taxi driver who suggested me to stay there and in fact the hotel is doing really good. The lobby is very spacious and the staff, specially from the front desk, was really helpfull. I stayed in a riverview room and the view is magnificient, the rooms are ok, nice bed and tv. The breakfast is also good.
reviews.title: great surprise
Sounds great!
reviews.text: We wanted to try the spa but there was no time for it but we had dinner in the restaurant in the last night and we asked for a steak, gotta say that it was really good and was cooked right in front of us.

aka: Holiday Inn Porto Gaia Hotel Vila Nova De Gaia
description: Choose the Holiday Inn Porto Gaia and enjoy the magnificent views over the Vila Nova Gaia and Porto cities. The Holiday Inn Porto Gaia is a four star deluxe hotel located in the heart of Vila Nova de Gaia – Porto. The hotel is only a short distance from the worldwide famous port wine cellars, the historical city center of Oporto, blue flag beaches and also train and metro station. We welcome you into our inviting and ample lobby where you can enjoy different sensations. Try the flavors of typical Portuguese food in our restaurant and bar "Food & Friends." Our rooms and suites are the perfect place to disconnect from the outside world and appreciate the small details like the complimentary internet access. Our executive floor located on the 22nd floor is an experience that you need to try. All the bedrooms located in this floor have access to the executive lounge where every day from 18h00 you have an open bar and canapés, to the gym and the amazing panoramic view over the river Douro and the cities of Vila Nova de Gaia e Porto. The hotel Holiday Inn is the perfect choice for your meeting or event. We have at your disposal a congress center with 1500 m2 and 16 meeting rooms equipped with stat of the art audiovisual technology and a group of specialized professionals that will help you. Its strategic location with Porto Congress center, the short distance from the Trade Fair Centers – Exponor and Europarque and the airport Sá Carneiro make Holiday Inn Porto Gaia the perfect choice for leisure as well as business trips.
